title: Moto G Indian Thread [Pricing, Availability, Reviews, Support and More]

threads.text:
I was thinking about getting this phone to replace my old and tired Galaxy Y.

I wonder what the price will be...
Somewhere around 11-12K maybe?
Looking at the Nexus 5 pricing and as they will have to include headphones in the box as per Indian law, I think 16gb will cost around 18k. I hope Motorola prices it close to 15k.
Moto G 8GB is available for Rs.15,990 and 16GB for Rs.17,990 at eBay India including all taxes and import duties. It was imported from US.

Right now, Moto G costs 200USD [16GB version]

Convert that to INR = Around 12,000 Rs
 + Around 30% Tax = 16,500 - 17,000 Rs

Detailed review of Moto G

http://www.theverge.com/2013/12/2/5156546/moto-g-review

prices of smartphones in india are almost same as in UK, where 16gb versions costs about 16K (inr), so adding a charger+Dual Sim+Headphones may increase price upto 2K so  i think 16-18K is a good guess for 16gb version in india. Also if they launch single sim version without charger and headphones, it would be a better option

title: [ROM][5.1.1][Experimental] CyanogenMod 12.1 | Linaro 4.9 | Code Review

threads.text: Nice man ... Will be giving this a shot. Do you have a bug tracker set up or do you want logs and reports posted here?

replies.text:
Feel free to post logs / bugs here.  Mainly have time to build after work on weekdays.  On the weekends is when I can actually work on fixing things.

For device specific things just post the bugs / logs here.  For CM specific bugs I would use JIRA and post a link to the bug here.  (More helpful/useful to the CM team to make an actual JIRA bug report.)

threads.text:
Yummy. Also trying this out for sure. 


Edit: Sub'd, Muuahahaha!....Oh.

3 WORDS: STABLE AS ****! 
thanks for the rom, this will forsure be my daily driver. only little problem is the no service icon (xt1031) but data is working. soft reboot fixes it though!

Can anyone please comment on the speed of this ROM since it is Linaro based? The other 5.1 ROMs on my phone are pretty responsive, but if even more speed can be gained with our limited hardware, that will be great.

Hello there @CodyF86 ! Thanks for you work! One little request.  Do you think you will be able to add a mirror or upload your work to another claudbased storage? Like MEGA or Mediafire or AndroidFileHost or whichever you want. This one you are using is insanely unstable for me. It gets interrupted every 5 minutes. I'll be really glad if you could change it or add other(s).

Cheers.
I'll upload to Google drive starting tonight also.  Driving home from work, will do another one.

replies.text:
Thank you very much! And sorry for bothering you with this. I really want to test your ROM since al Linaro builds seem gone from this forum. Thanks again. Drive safe 

Cheers.

threads.text:
New build posted.  Main link is to Google drive now.

Some more  ARM assembly fun if you look under the kernel source commits.

Will fix the signal indicator so you don't have to do a soft reboot for it to work this weekend.  Need to go through the soak test build.prop and compare a few other things...just need time this weekend.
Nice man ... Will be giving this a shot. Do you have a bug tracker set up or do you want logs and reports posted here?
I'll upload to Google drive starting tonight also.  Driving home from work, will do another one.

title: [Q] How to build/install Android M developer preview on my Moto G?
[Q&A] [ROM][5.1][Experimental] CyanogenMod 12.1 | Linaro 4.9 | Code Review

threads.text: it's great thank you

ROM is working great on XT1033 (Moto G 2013 - Dual Sim). Didn't need to soft boot or anything of the sort. Cleaned everything except internal memory and installed the ROM. As of now, its AWESOME!!
Will test for the usual bugs and let you know.. [EDIT] I've found none of the bugs that I encountered in the other 5.1 ROMs out there... Simply Superb work!!

P.S: The G-Apps in the latest build link was for 5.0.x. Gave me an error while flashing. The G-Apps for 5.1 is posted by euroskank at fitsnugly.euroskank.com under banks(Google "android 5.1 gapps"). Sorry... can't post links till I reach 10 posts..
The rom is working fairly well, no signal icon bug, smooth and with effective memory management. Battery life is reasonable, but not close to CM11 Roms.

One question : Should i flash the 41.18 first to flash this ROM? Because in AOSP i get screen flickering issue

Thanks
Let's try 20150426 out.

http://forum.xda-developers.com/show...&postcount=233

Look for Q10 on how to update to the newer bootloader
I get stuck at the CyanogenMod Boot Logo its been loading for 20 mins lol
Does anyone else get the message: Insert a SIM to send SMS whenever using Hangouts to send a text?
How do I enter build. Prep info in bootloader for the latest builds from 5-4-15?
Thanks for the help guys I'll just go back to kit Kat

title: Moto G Hard case review : the cheap one

threads.text:
I have one of these on all my devices..very user friendly, can flip around and use the device while in the beltclip..very slim and light weight, and great protection..very easy to clip into your pocket, slide device out and use without the clip..or use device in the clip, propt in landscape or portrait mode, for watching movies also..I have had the Krakens and all those fancy / expensive cases..but I finally found my true love for a case..unless you work in construction, or heavy duty..this case is the perfect choice..

http://m.ebay.com/itm/370987205264?nav=WATCHING_ACTIVE

sent by my 4.2.2_12.15.15
(Unlocked) XT1080M Droid Maxx #1
http://waynekent.com/page6.html
filled the hole after removing the belt clip (that i won't use) with a glow-in-the-dark plastic plate :
Tq. I was waiting for this review. I love this case but I'm somehow disinterested after read about the dust issue on rubber part. I can feel how the material is from your pics.
Recently bought Pink version for girlfriend's peregrine, will post a review soon :

l buy that case in green color is very nice and thanks to this case my moto g still alive.
l buy it for 18 USD on a local store, here all the tech is very expensive and limited.

it looks like give enough protection
but it seems makes the moto g look bulky

Here is the seven months later review of my cheap hard case:
http://andrux-and-me.blogspot.fr/201...or-moto-g.html

title: Lollipop Android 5.0.1 On Moto G XT1033 Preview
Custom ROM review Moto G Dualsim XT1033

threads.text:
I have tried two roms  gummy and PA

best one : PA
reason : stable,good response,battery,connecting to data network easily compared to stock and gummy rom
cons: comparatively less customization

gummy: 
pros: has some additional features
cons: discontinued, When i used even the final version there was a rotation bug with xt1033 which was rectified by replacing some .so files from old builds, battery is not that great compared to PA

PAC-MAN ROM
pac_falcon-nightly-20141021.zip
I get navigation bar and statusbar did't show .

pac_falcon-nightly-20141020.zip
In this older build working good no issues except slim recents didnt work

I have tried almost all dual sim supported custom roms.
In all roms I got this annoying issue of not able to call from people app. On touch of a contact number in people app nothing happens.
So ended up using the same roms after converting to GPE.
I always do clean flash. I use latest philz recovery to format system, cache and data. Except usb storage, I wipe everything before flashing any rom. I even tried flashing through adb sideload after formatting everything. But I still face this issue when I flash any dual sim supported custom rom on stock 4.4.4.
If anybody has faced this issue and able to fix this, please help me.
My most favorite until now is CrDroid which provides tons of customization.

replies.text: Agree with you on custom rom Cr droid.       Best rom so far with best speed and no errors is Stock rom or roms that have as base   stockrom.
crDroid + Xperience kernel = Speed + Power + Smoothness

threads.text:
I have been using N5 Experience from last one month...
Pros : lots of customization, overall its smooth
Cons : Sometimes phones hangs up randomly and reboot becomes the only option, Battery drains a bit faster than stock

[UPDATE:]We've gotten official word that there will only be three colours available in Canada (Black, White and Royal Blue) and that they will be available from TELUS for $34.99.
The Official Flip Shell is now available from Amazon UK. £18.
Yeah, that price is almost 1/4 of what I paid for the phone. Hopefully an unofficial Flip Cover with working magnet unlock mechanism will appear as an alternative.
Only in white though, still waiting for a black one.

Stock ROM 

Pros: The most stable rom

Cons: I hate those Moto Apps, But then I've deleted them already
Which ROM you have use ? And What's condition is your ROM ?
I suggest to post a Benchmark, and Every tweak you use. Maybe battery stats could be helpfull. He is on the Stock ROM!
Just updated to SlimKat5 with no problems yet.  Did a full wipe before install and used minimal gapps.  Great ROM!

I've tried most of the roms, but always go back stock ROM. What bothers me this initial lag when starting the phone with most CM ROMs. Also the battery on my stock rom is the longest and with the new update to the 176 earshot is really great
So I inserted Nova launcher and customize it as much as I can
The other Rom I like most is AOSP + 4.2

title: (req) android L preview port to Moto G?

threads.text: Only a matter of porting system images that are coming to the n5 and n7 but that would be hard to do..
It doesn't matter we'll be getting it sooner than the others. So stay calm and wait

It is possible but first you need to edit or create a device tree. (Only an AOSP device tree is compatible I guess)

You need a kernel tree, AND a vendor tree.

Motorola has published the Moto G GPE sources in the 'falcon' branch here, just view the latest release:

http://github.com/motorolamobilityllc

So we need real developers to edit these trees. I know how to compile roms, but I DON'T know how to edit device trees.

So I don't think it's really necessary because it's only a Developer Preview and I prefer an official Android L release first...
